title: SOFA score calculation
text: Asuming data loaded dataframe df, SOFA score can calculated two different ways.

title: SOFA score calculation
text: Use sofa_magic_wrapper() function use raw data file Acutelines database. SOFA related variables coded SOFA_[timespan]h_[variable]. Make sure variables present. interval can used set time stap interval correspondance dataset, timespan can use set maximum timespan.

title: SOFA score calculation
text: dataset different naming schema (SOFA_[timespan]h_[variable] format), can still calculate SOFA score package, however, provide package mapping column dataset corresponding acutal element SOFA score. First define mapping: pass mapping sofa_total function along dataframe:
code: column_mapping <- c(   PaO2 = "your_PaO2_variable",   SpO2 = "your_SpO2_variable",   FiO2 = "your_FiO2_variable",   oxygen_supply = "your_oxygen_supply_variable",   platelets = "your_platelets_variable",   bilirubin = "your_bilirubin_variable",   MAP = "your_MAP_variable",   dopamine = "your_dopamine_variable",   dobutamine = "your_dobutamine_variable",   epinephrine = "your_epinephrine_variable",   norepinephrine = "your_norepineprhine_variable",   norepinephrine_amp = "your_norepinephrine_amp_variable",   GCS = "your_GCS_variable",   creatinine = "your_creatinine_variable" ) result <- sofa_total(df, column_mapping)

title: SOFA score calculation
text: SOFA (Sequential Organ Failure Assessment) calculation functions designed provide worst SOFA score patient within specific interval. retrospectively calculating SOFA score, one must address missing values inaccurately recorded values. function automatically handles issues. Consequently, SOFA score functions incorporate several assumptions ensure feasible calculations. Users aware assumptions utilizing functions.

title: Toolbox to work with Acutelines biobak data.
text: package can used work data extracted Acutelines data- biobank. provides tools parse data extracts perform calculations uniform matter. Acutelines multi-disciplinary prospective hospital-based cohort study examining 24/7 complete acute patient journey admitted ED University Medical Centre Groningen (UMCG), tertiary care teaching hospital Netherlands. employs broad range investigative procedures assessing pre-hospital, -hospital, long-term health factors affect outcome patients acute conditions. cohort population broadly representative people living Northern Netherlands acute medical conditions. Detailed information cohort participant selection can found elsewhere [1] [2]. Participants asked written informed consent, applicable proxy. Acutelines cohort study approved medical ethics committee UMCG, Netherlands registered trial registration number NCT04615065 ClinicalTrials.gov [2]. www.acutelines.nl ter Avest E, van Munster BC, van Wijk RJ, et al Cohort profile Acutelines: large data/biobank acute emergency medicine. BMJ Open 2021;11:e047349. doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2020-047349

what: Magic wrapper to automatically calculate the SOFA score on multiple intervals (eg. hours, days) assuming the data is exported using Acutelines SOFA SQL snippet. Note: this function assumes data is exported using the Acutelines SOFA export snippet, if not manually define columns and use sofa_total(). — sofa_magic_wrapper
title: Magic wrapper to automatically calculate the SOFA score on multiple intervals (eg. hours, days) assuming the data is exported using Acutelines SOFA SQL snippet. Note: this function assumes data is exported using the Acutelines SOFA export snippet, if not manually define columns and use sofa_total(). — sofa_magic_wrapper
text: Magic wrapper automatically calculate SOFA score multiple intervals (eg. hours, days) assuming data exported using Acutelines SOFA SQL snippet. Note: function assumes data exported using Acutelines SOFA export snippet, manually define columns use sofa_total().

title: Magic wrapper to automatically calculate the SOFA score on multiple intervals (eg. hours, days) assuming the data is exported using Acutelines SOFA SQL snippet. Note: this function assumes data is exported using the Acutelines SOFA export snippet, if not manually define columns and use sofa_total(). — sofa_magic_wrapper
code: sofa_magic_wrapper(   df,   interval = 24,   timespan = 72,   return_df = FALSE,   naming.cols = "SOFA_<interval>h_<variable>",   naming.result = "SOFAscore_<interval>h_<variable>" )

title: Magic wrapper to automatically calculate the SOFA score on multiple intervals (eg. hours, days) assuming the data is exported using Acutelines SOFA SQL snippet. code: if (FALSE) { column_mapping <- c(  PaO2 = "SOFA_24h_PaO2",  SpO2 = "SOFA_24h_SpO2",  FiO2 = "SOFA_24h_FiO2",  oxygen_supply = "SOFA_24h_oxygen_supply",  platelets = "SOFA_24h_platelets",  bilirubin = "SOFA_24h_bilirubin",  MAP = "SOFA_24h_MAP",  dopamine = "SOFA_24h_dopamine",  dobutamine = "SOFA_24h_dobutamine",  epinephrine = "SOFA_24h_epinephrine",  norepinephrine = "SOFA_24h_norepineprhine",  norepinephrine_amp = "SOFA_24h_norepinephrine_amp",  GCS = "SOFA_24h_GCS",  creatinine = "SOFA_24h_creatinine"  ) result <- sofa_total(df, column_mapping) }
